info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 7:02PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHERN BEAVER...SOUTH CENTRAL LAWRENCE AND WEST CENTRAL BUTLER COUNTIES THROUGH 730 PM EDT... At 702 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Beaver Falls, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Beaver Falls, Ellwood City, New Brighton, Zelienople, Patterson Township, Big Beaver, New Beaver, West Mayfield, Ellport, Harmony, Koppel, Patterson Heights, New Galilee, Enon Valley, Fallston, Darlington, Eastvale, and Homewood. This includes the following highways... Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 8 and 21. Interstate 376 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 25 and 33. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
